answers.answer: I have it. The only way its changed my pregnancy is having to watch what I eat and no snacking in between meals. My baby is healthy and right on track.

Idk if i have it or not my one hour test came back slightly high and I'm literally in the hospital right now for the 3 hour test...i hope i don't have it but who knows....my cousin had it and she said she hated it

Ladybug thanks for assuring me things could be OK! I just found out this morning I failed my 3 hr an I'm really upset by it ..I just dont want it to affect her or I an her become a very large baby at birth I'm not due till June 22 so its really upsetting ! Lilducky good luck! I hear its pretty common for people to fail the one hour an pass the 3 hr! I was one of the 8% who got preeclampsia with my previous pregnancy !

I have to test my blood sugar 4 times a day..I had it with my previous pregnancy too. It takes a week or so to get in the groove of not snacking inbetween sugar testings. Just remember to drink alot of water (it flushes the sugars out) and also to exercise (it also helps regulate your blood sugar) So if I have time... I will eat my dinner and then go out for like a 20 min walk or longer if I can and my blood sugar is always good when I have to test it.

Oh lovely 4 times a day!!! Aren't your fingers sore? How much longer do you have left with it? How do you deal with not eating? I'm always starving and my biggest problem is going to be sweets I usually hate sweets but this pregnancy that's all I crave !!! :-/ do you have to see a high risk doctor once a month for sonograms?

I just did my glucose test today. So I'm not sure if I have it or not. While pregnant with my daughter in 2011 I failed the 1hr but passes the 3hr. With the doctor I see no she only does a 2hr screening and it's pass or fail.

No there there just tiny needles and my fingers don't get sore. I just try to keep myself busy...You have to eat your meal and then wait 2hours to test. When Im at work I have no problem but when Im home I'm literally counting down the minutes! Lol Im 31 weeks now so only been on the "diet" for a couple of weeks now, it gets easier. they will explain everything to you. And no I will probably have only one sonogram around 35-36 weeks to see how big he is. Most doctor's will not let you go past your due date with gestational diabetes, my doctor likes to induce a week early.

Thank you for the info it helps out!! I go next Friday to the fetal doctor to learn about it! I don't think I'm going to make it to my due date anyway lol I just hope she doesnt get to big from it :-/ and I hope we are both OK!!! Did they say how long after delivery it takes to go away?

I have GD too.  I went to my diabetes education class today and immediately went grocery shopping :). They told me to eat three meals and three snacks a day.  I have to count my carbs.  My doctor said that most people's blood sugar is back to normal within 2 hours of delivering.  It is caused by a hormone that is produced in the placenta.  So when you deliver and get rid of the placenta, your glucose levels should normalize.
Yep as soon as you deliver! I remember with my last pregnancy making my husband go to the gift shop to buy me some candy cause the doctor said I didn't have to worry about my sugar anymore! Lol
My auntie just had a baby last week she had gd and the baby was 7lbs 15oz... Average size! They told her baby was 9lbs... goodluck!!

Thank you everyone!! I just pray everything goes smoothly!! I will be doing exactly what I'm told to do to protect my little girl an myself! Glad it does t sound to bad an its something I can deal with !

I had it too, just watch your carb intake. I found I could eat as much meat and protein as I liked, with a salad or vegies(no potatoes) and the sugars were fine. Id even make an omelet for a snack if I was really hungry and snack on diet yogurts for my sweet tooth. If I ate something naughty like some hot chips or a burger, I'd go for a half hour walk to keep the sugar levels down. You will soon work out what works for you and your body.
And by the way, had my bub last night, he was 5lb 13oz!! That was at 38+6.

Thank you thirdtimemum I feel so much better!!! I drink lots of water an An I'll def be walking a lot especially since it will be getting warmer out I will def so the best I can is love for her to be a 5 lb some oz baby! :-) I don't think I'm making it to my due sate that's for sure lol u don't go till next Friday to my gest diabetes class so I will try to do the best I can before hand they told me my numbers weren't really bad they were really just border lined. But just wanted to treat me!

question: Anyone on here been diagnosed with gestational diabetes and I'f so how has it changed your pregnancy and baby?
title: gestational diabetes
